data.title: Freshwater from icebergs
data.statement:
You are an iceberg hunter, thanks to your equipment, you have obtained a mapping of the iceberg. You are seeking to determine the total volume of possible natural reservoirs above sea level, capable of containing fresh water within the iceberg you see.

<<Natural reservoirs>> are areas where water can accumulate, typically marked by ledges, and cannot sink into the sea. In other words, <<a reservoir is a group of nothing (an empty U shaped area), above sea level, that is surrounded by ice>>.

The level of the sea is represented by solid line of tilde {{~}}, nothing by a space and the ice by the letter {{x}}.

The diagram below explains why the answer to the first test is 2.
```
      xx    
   x  xxx     <- 2 spaces
~~~xxxxxx~~~     within the
 x xxxxxx        U-shaped area
 xxxx xxx        formed by
 xx   xx         the ice
 x    x     
 ```

testCases.title: Simple Test
testCases.testIn:
12 8
            
      xx    
   x  xxx   
~~~xxxxxx~~~
 x xxxxxx   
 xxxx xxx   
 xx   xx    
 x    x

testCases.title: Simple Test
testCases.testIn:
12 8
            
   x  xx    
   x   xx   
~~~xxxxxx~~~
 x xxxxxx   
 xxxx xxx   
 xx   xx    
 x    x

testCases.title: No reservoir 2
testCases.testIn:
15 11
               
       x       
      xxxx     
    xxxxxxx    
~~~xxxxxxxxxx~~
   xxxxxxxxx   
      xxxxxx   
    x xxxxx    
    xxxxxx     
     xxx       
     x

testCases.title: No reservoir 2
testCases.testIn:
15 11
               
    xxxx       
    xxxx       
    xxxxxxx    
~~~xxxxxxxxxx~~
   xxxxxxxxx   
      xxxxxx   
    x xxxxx    
    xxxxxx     
     xxx       
     x

testCases.title: Big iceberg 1
testCases.testIn:
22 14
                      
          x           
         xxx   xx     
        xxxxxxxxxx    
  xx  xxxxxxxxxxx     
  xxxxxxxxxxxxx   x   
~~~~~~~xxxxxxxxxxxx~~~
     xxxxxxxx  xxxx   
   xx  xxxxxxxxxx     
   xxxxxx  xxxxxxxx   
    xxxx     xxxxxx   
     xx      xxxx     
              xx

testCases.testIn:
22 14
                      
          x           
         xxx   xx     
        xxxxx  xxx    
  xx    xxxxxxxxx     
  xxxxxxxxxxxxx   x   
~~~~~~~xxxxxxxxxxxx~~~
     xxxxxxxx  xxxx   
   xx  xxxxxxxxxx     
   xxxxxx  xxxxxxxx   
    xxxx     xxxxxx   
     xx      xxxx     
              xx

22 15
                      
             x        
             xx       
    xx      xxxxx     
   xxxx     xxxxxx    
  xxxxxxxxxxxxxx      
  xxxxxxxxxxxxx   x   
~~~~~~~xxxxxxxxxxxx~~~

testCases.testIn:
22 15
                      
             x

    xx      xxxxx

data.stubGenerator:
read X:int Y:int
loop Y read LINE:string(X)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> Two space-separated integers [[X]] and [[Y]] for the line length and the number of lines.
<<[[Y]] next lines :>> A string containing: spaces, the letter {{x}} or tildes {{~}}.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> An integer representing the total volume of possible natural freshwater reservoirs above sea level.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are an iceberg hunter, thanks to your equipment, you have obtained a mapping of the iceberg. You are seeking to determine the total volume of possible natural reservoirs above sea level, capable of containing fresh water within the iceberg you see.

Natural reservoirs are areas where water can accumulate, typically marked by ledges, and cannot sink into the sea. In other words, a reservoir is a group of nothing (an empty U shaped area), above sea level, that is surrounded by ice.

The level of the sea is represented by solid line of tilde ~, nothing by a space and the ice by the letter x.

The diagram below explains why the answer to the first test is 2.

      xx    
   x  xxx     <- 2 spaces
~~~xxxxxx~~~     within the
 x xxxxxx        U-shaped area
 xxxx xxx        formed by
 xx   xx         the ice
 x    x     
 





   

      
Input

      
Line 1 : Two space-separated integers X and Y for the line length and the number of lines.
Y next lines : A string containing: spaces, the letter x or tildes ~.

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1 : An integer representing the total volume of possible natural freshwater reservoirs above sea level.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
2 ≤ X ≤ 100
2 ≤ Y ≤ 100

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
12 8
            
      xx    
   x  xxx   
~~~xxxxxx~~~
 x xxxxxx   
 xxxx xxx   
 xx   xx    
 x    x     

         

         

            
Output

            
2
